title: (Pwn2Own) Samsung Galaxy S10 Call Control Setup Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung Galaxy 10. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must answer a phone call.
The specific flaw exists within the Call Control Setup messages. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length, stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the baseband processor.
addtionnal_details: Samsung has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://security.samsungmobile.com/securityUpdate.smsb
timeline:
2019-11-07 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-02-20 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2020-02-21 - Advisory Updated
